alert.note: Alert for Meade (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 08 at 10:29PM CDT until July 11 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kansas... Crooked Creek Near Englewood affecting Meade County. For the Crooked Creek...including Englewood...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Crooked Creek Near Englewood. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Expect moderate flooding along most streches of Crooked Creek in southern Meade County. Both riverbanks will experience inundations up to 2 feet as the floodwaters continue their expansion onto the floodplain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 6.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM CDT Saturday was 7.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.7 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 6.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.6 feet on 05/01/1978. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 1030 AM CDT.
